t: James 4
Pride Promotes Strife
Where*p do wars and fights come*i from among you? Do they*i not come*i from your desires*i for*i pleasure that war in your members?
You lust and do not have. You murder and covet and cannot obtain. You fight and war. Yet you do not have because you do not ask.
You ask and do not receive, because you ask amiss, that you may spend it*i on your pleasures.
Adulterers and adulteresses! Do you not know that friendship with the world is enmity with God? Whoever therefore wants to be a friend of the world makes himself an enemy of God.
Or do you think that the Scripture says in vain, “The Spirit who dwells in us yearns jealously”?
But*p He gives more grace. Therefore He says: “God*pn resists the proud, But*ld gives grace to the humble.”
Humility Cures Worldliness
Therefore*p submit to God. Resist the devil and he will flee from you.
Draw near to God and He will draw near to you. Cleanse your*i hands, you*i sinners; and purify your*i hearts, you*i double-minded.
Lament and mourn and weep! Let your laughter be turned to mourning and your*i joy to gloom.
Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and He will lift you up.
Do Not Judge a Brother

Do*p not speak evil of one another, brethren. He who speaks evil of a brother and judges his brother, speaks evil of the law and judges the law. But if you judge the law, you are not a doer of the law but a judge.
There is one Lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy. Who are you to judge another?
Do Not Boast About Tomorrow
Come*p now, you who say, “Today or tomorrow we will go to such and such a city, spend a year there, buy and sell, and make a profit”;
whereas you do not know what will*i happen*i tomorrow. For what is*i your life? It is even a vapor that appears for a little time and then vanishes away.
Instead you ought*i to say, “If the Lord wills, we shall live and do this or that.”
But now you boast in your arrogance. All such boasting is evil.
Therefore,*p to him who knows to do good and does not do it,*i to him it is sin.
